b.i: Monforton School is a nurturing, student-centered community where all are encouraged to believe in themselves as they are actively immersed in the process of learning in a safe, respectful environment.

div.class: g-cols wpb_row type_default valign_middle vc_inner vc_custom_1543339761095

hr.p: Kindergarten is a year full of new experiences. We believe in fostering a positive, engaging, and fun first year for your child!
Our goals are to help your children be fluent readers, independent problem-solvers, efficient writers and curious and compassionate students.
We want each student to have countless opportunities to succeed. Different levels of ability, development and interests are accepted, expected and used to design instruction and curriculum.

div.class: g-cols wpb_row type_default valign_middle vc_inner vc_custom_1543339761095

hr.p: In 3rd grade we work to help students adjust to the more rigorous academic expectations and shifts in social priorities that begin as they transition into the upper elementary grades.
Our goal is to prep your children for the start of their education in the Monforton School System. Social behavior and basic reading skills will be our focus.
As the bridge year between elementary and middle school, our focus is on organization, responsibility and personal growth.

div.class: g-cols wpb_row type_default valign_middle vc_inner vc_custom_1543339761095

hr.p: 6th Graders are navigating the transitions and managing materials, homework, and responsible use of technology. Students are utilizing Infinite Campus.
7th graders are becoming more comfortable in articulating their learning, and confident in their academic abilities and social position.

Our focus is on them becoming independent in using organization skills, taking ownership of their education and advocating for themselves. These skills are crucial in students’ success in high school and beyond.
